title: Suvarna Collection saree catalog (mobile-first) with WhatsApp ordering

requirements.summary: Build an Android-first, lightweight Home screen with clear branding and obvious navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile widths, the Home screen loads quickly and clearly shows “Suvarna Collection” and a tagline in English
Layout uses mobile-first spacing, readable font sizes, and large tap targets
Navigation to the other sections is obvious and usable with one hand

file_operations.description: Create the app shell with mobile-first routing and a persistent one-hand-friendly navigation structure (e.g., bottom navigation) that links to Home, Catalog, Offers, New Arrivals, and Contact. Use shadcn/ui layout-friendly primitives where applicable (e.g., Card, Button). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement the Home screen showing the business name “Suvarna Collection” and an English tagline, plus clear shortcuts/links to Catalog, Offers, New Arrivals, and Contact. Use shadcn/ui Button/Card for tap-friendly shortcuts. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a mobile-first bottom navigation component with large tap targets and clear labels/icons (if available) to support one-handed navigation. Use shadcn/ui Button for consistent interactive styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement a Saree Catalog listing with product cards and a Product Details view.
acceptanceCriteria: Catalog displays at least a small seeded set of products containing all required fields (image, name, price, fabric, occasion)
Each product can be opened to view its details without losing the ability to return to the catalog
Images are displayed with consistent aspect ratio and do not cause layout shift

file_operations.description: Create the Catalog screen that renders a scrollable list/grid of sarees with image, name, price, fabric, and occasion; include loading/empty states and navigation into a product details route. Use shadcn/ui Card/Skeleton to keep UI consistent. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a Product Details view (route-based) that shows a single product’s full details and supports returning to the catalog without losing context. Use shadcn/ui components (Card, Badge, Button) for consistent presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable product card component displaying consistent-aspect image (prevent layout shift), name, price, fabric, occasion, and quick actions (including WhatsApp Order). Use shadcn/ui Card and Button. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire Catalog and Product Details routes into the router and ensure navigation works end-to-end from Home and bottom navigation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a per-product WhatsApp Order action using configurable wa.me link and prefilled English message.
acceptanceCriteria: Each product card/details view includes a clearly labeled “WhatsApp Order” button
Clicking the button opens a wa.me link with a prefilled message that includes the product name and price
The WhatsApp/phone number is configurable in one obvious place (e.g., a single config constant) without code changes across multiple files

file_operations.description: Add a single, obvious configuration module that stores the business WhatsApp/phone number used for wa.me links (and can also hold contact info used elsewhere).

Implement a reusable “WhatsApp Order” button that builds a wa.me URL using the configured number and a prefilled English message including product name and price; use shadcn/ui Button for consistent primary action styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add the WhatsAppOrderButton to each product card and ensure the label is clearly visible and tap-friendly. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add the WhatsAppOrderButton to the product details view as the primary action, ensuring clear visual hierarchy and mobile-friendly placement. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Create Offers and New Arrivals sections accessible via navigation and linked to the shared product details experience.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can access both “Offers” and “New Arrivals” from the app navigation (and/or clear Home shortcuts)
Each section displays items with at least image, name, and price, and can link back to the same product details experience as the catalog
Seed data includes at least one Offer item and one New Arrival item

file_operations.description: Create an Offers screen that lists offer-marked products with image, name, and price; reuse SareeCard and link into the existing Product Details view. Use shadcn/ui components for consistent layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a New Arrivals screen that lists new-arrival-marked products with image, name, and price; reuse SareeCard and link into the existing Product Details view. Use shadcn/ui components for consistent layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire Offers and New Arrivals routes into the router and ensure they are reachable from navigation and/or Home shortcuts. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add prominent Home shortcuts/sections that navigate to Offers and New Arrivals without adding extra top-level pages beyond the required ones. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a Contact page with configurable phone/location and tap-friendly call/maps actions in English.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact page shows a phone number and a location string
Phone number is tappable (tel: link) on mobile
Location includes an external link that opens a maps site in a new tab/window
Phone number and location are stored in a single configurable place (constants/config)

file_operations.description: Create a Contact page that reads phone number and location from the single config module, renders a tel: link, and provides an external maps link that opens in a new tab/window. Use shadcn/ui Button/Card for tap-friendly actions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add/confirm contact configuration values (phone number and location text + maps URL) alongside the WhatsApp configuration so all contact details are configured in one place.
Add Contact route wiring and include Contact in the primary navigation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive, elegant Indian theme (warm neutrals with maroon/gold accents; avoid blue/purple) across all screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Consistent theme across Home, Catalog, Offers/New Arrivals, and Contact screens
Palette and styling feel “Indian/elegant” (e.g., warm neutrals with maroon/gold accents) without reducing readability
All primary actions (especially WhatsApp Order) have a clear visual hierarchy and accessible contrast

file_operations.description: Define global styles and theme tokens (CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn) using warm neutral background with maroon/gold accents; ensure readable typography and accessible contrast; keep styles lightweight and consistent.

Apply the global theme consistently via shared layout wrappers (background, spacing, typography), ensuring primary actions (WhatsApp Order) are visually prominent across screens. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adjust/extend Tailwind theme configuration only as needed to support the warm neutral + maroon/gold palette and consistent radii/shadows, avoiding blue/purple accents.

requirements.summary: Fetch catalog/products from the backend actor using React Query and render loading/empty states.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods to list all products and to list/filter by Offers and New Arrivals (or exposes fields that allow the frontend to filter reliably)
Frontend loads catalog data via React Query and renders loading/empty states
App functions end-to-end with seeded backend data without requiring manual data entry

file_operations.description: Create React Query hooks that use the existing useActor hook to fetch sarees (all, offers, new arrivals, and single by id) and provide loading/error/empty states to screens.

Replace any local listing logic with React Query-driven data from useSarees; show lightweight loading skeletons and an empty-state message if no products are returned. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Load offer items using React Query (or reliably filter by isOffer) and render loading/empty states; reuse the shared product card/details navigation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Load new arrivals using React Query (or reliably filter by isNewArrival) and render loading/empty states; reuse the shared product card/details navigation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Fetch a single product by id using React Query and render loading/error states with a clear back path to the prior list screen. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add generated static brand/product placeholder images as frontend public assets and render them in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are added under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI
Catalog items use the generated placeholder product images by default
No backend endpoints are created to serve image bytes

file_operations.description: Add the generated static image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/suvarna-logo.dim_512x512.png and reference it from the Home/app shell branding.
Add the generated static image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/textile-pattern.dim_1440x2560.png and use it as a subtle background (without hurting readability/performance).
Add the generated static image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/saree-placeholder-1.dim_800x800.png and use it as a default product placeholder image.
Add the generated static image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/saree-placeholder-2.dim_800x800.png and use it as an alternate product placeholder image for visual variety.

Wire the generated logo image (frontend/public/assets/generated/suvarna-logo.dim_512x512.png) into the Home branding area while keeping the UI lightweight and mobile-first. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Reference the generated textile background image (frontend/public/assets/generated/textile-pattern.dim_1440x2560.png) in global styling in a subtle, performant way.

Ensure product images default to the generated saree placeholders (frontend/public/assets/generated/saree-placeholder-1.dim_800x800.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/saree-placeholder-2.dim_800x800.png) when a product imageUrl is missing/empty, and enforce consistent aspect ratio to prevent layout shift. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
